Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw and identify different kinds of living things in a specific land habitat, like a garden or forest. (e.g., may include trees, flowers, birds, and insects)
The student can draw and identify different kinds of living things in a specific water habitat, like a pond or stream. (e.g., may include fish, frogs, aquatic plants)
The student can show different types of plants in both land and water habitats, such as trees, grasses, and flowering plants.
The student can show different types of animals in both land and water habitats, such as fish in the water habitat and squirrels in the land habitat.
The student can compare the types of living things found in different habitats by drawing both habitats and some of their inhabitants side by side.
The student can organize and label their drawings clearly for the types of plants and animals in each habitat, but may miss a few labels.
CANNOT: The student might not show all possible species correctly or omit some common species. (e.g., only one type of fish in the water habitat)
The student may inconsistently label some organisms or occasionally misspell names. (e.g., 'lizerd' instead of 'lizard')
The student may have minor inaccuracies in proportion or scale between plants and animals. (e.g., a fish being too large compared to trees in a pond drawing)
